title: Arteaga Municipality, Michoacán
text:
Arteaga () is a <a href="municipality%20%28Mexico%29">municipality</a> located in the southern region of the <a href="Mexican%20state">Mexican state</a> of <a href="Michoac%C3%A1n">Michoacán</a>. The municipality has an area of 3,454.71 square kilometres (5.87% of the surface of the state) and is bordered to the north by the municipality of <a href="La%20Huacana%20Municipality">La Huacana</a>, to the east by <a href="Churumuco">Churumuco</a> and the state of <a href="Guerrero">Guerrero</a>, to the south by <a href="L%C3%A1zaro%20C%C3%A1rdenas%2C%20Michoac%C3%A1n">Lázaro Cárdenas</a>, and to the west by <a href="Coalcom%C3%A1n%20de%20V%C3%A1zquez%20Pallares">Coalcomán de Vázquez Pallares</a>, <a href="Tumbiscat%C3%ADo">Tumbiscatío</a>, <a href="Aguililla">Aguililla</a> and <a href="Aquila%2C%20Michoac%C3%A1n">Aquila</a>. The municipality had a population of 21,173 inhabitants according to the 2005 census. Its 
municipal seat is the city of the same name.
The municipality is named in honour of General <a href="Jos%C3%A9%20Mar%C3%ADa%20Arteaga%20Magallanes">José María Arteaga Magallanes</a>, a 19th-century national hero and governor of the state of <a href="Quer%C3%A9taro%20de%20Arteaga">Querétaro de Arteaga</a>.
